Paragraph: Furthermore , the PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and a non-fullerene electron acceptor ( di-PBI ) showed a promising PCE of 4.23% , demonstrating that PTATDPP has good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors for high efficiency PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| di-PBI |
| PSCs (organic-photovoltaic cells, an abbreviation for "polymer solar cells") |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Furthermore , the PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and a non-fullerene electron acceptor ( di-PBI ) showed a promising PCE of 4.23% , demonstrating that PTATDPP has good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors for high efficiency PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| PTATDPP |
| di-PBI |

Explanation:

* PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) is a property name that refers to the ratio of electrical power produced by a solar cell to the power of sunlight falling on it.
* PTATDPP (Poly[[9,9-bis(2-ethylhexyl)fluorene]-2,7-diyl][2,2'-bithiophene]-5,5'-diyl[2-(2-hexyldecyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole-4,7-diyl]) is a property name that refers to a specific type of polymer used in the fabrication of the perovskite solar cell (PSC).
* di-PBI (perylene-diimide) is a property name that refers to a specific type of non-fullerene electron acceptor used in the fabrication of the PSC.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| di-PBI |

Explanation:

* PTATDPP (Poly[[9,9-bis(2-ethylhexyl)fluorene]-2,7-diyl][2,2'-bithiophene]-5,5'-diyl[2-(2-hexyldecyl)-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole-4,7-diyl]) is a property name that refers to a specific type of polymer used in the fabrication of the perovskite solar cell (PSC).
* di-PBI (perylene-diimide) is a property name that refers to a specific type of non-fullerene electron acceptor used in the fabrication of the PSC.

PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) is not a material property, it is a performance metric for solar cells. Therefore, it is not included in the table.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Furthermore , the PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and a non-fullerene electron acceptor ( di-PBI ) showed a promising PCE of 4.23% , demonstrating that PTATDPP has good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors for high efficiency PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| a promising PCE of 4.23% |
| good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors |

The two "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are "a promising PCE of 4.23%" and "good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors". The first entity refers to the power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the fabricated perovskite solar cell (PSC), while the second entity refers to the ability of PTATDPP to work well with various electron acceptors in high efficiency PSCs.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| a promising PCE of 4.23% |

After re-evaluating the paragraph, only one clear "Value of material property" entity was found, which is "a promising PCE of 4.23%". This entity refers to the power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the fabricated perovskite solar cell (PSC), which is a material property that indicates the efficiency of converting sunlight into electrical energy.

The other entity, "good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors", is not a clear "Value of material property" as it describes the compatibility of PTATDPP with other materials, rather than a specific property of the material itself.
